The story about the 23 year old golem
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Hoaxes, Myths and Pranks!: The story about the 23 year old golem
By RNA on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 12:45 am:

People have said many times that to make a monster have a long and successful life, you should use Dark Phoenix's or RNA's method. People make such a big deal about getting long lived and prosperous monsters without a method. Well, if accomplishing the above is a major feat, then i beleive i have mastered this game. Many, many times i have raised monsters to live in an excess of 10 years, including my infamous golem Nats who lived over 20 years, even though most people don't beleive that nats even existed, let alone lived 23 years. Although Nats was a great feat, i must say, this will come as a shock to you all: I have beaten Nats's record. My newest monster, an Ebony (Mock/Joker) lived in an excess of 25 years. for the exact age, you must be willing to take the truth, so i ask that you e-mail me privatly at rapman243@aol.com for the exact life span. Note that this was acheived without RNA's or Dark Phoenix's methods. I have been using my own method all along. I posted a minor method on this board awhile back, but was deleted in the Bobby Fatman episode. My new method i have revealed to only the people who i see as worthy and trustable friends, the people who won't let this slip, for it is a great secret which i must keep. If you desire the ultimate raising method, e-mail me at the address below. thank you for your time.

-- golem man (rapman243@aol.com), March 23, 2000

there's a guy here in michigan named mitch rompola[sp?]. he claimed to have killed a record buck. but he wouldn't let anyone test it, and became abusive to those who wanted to give it the standard testing before taking his word for it. eventually, it was not certified as a record, and mitch was left to mutter darkly about conspiracies and "the establishment". unfortunately, whether or not he actually had taken the buck, he is now regarded by the majority as a fraud.
unfortunately for you, golem man, that is your reputation on this board. you may not care, and you may actually have raised two 23+ year old monsters, but until you open yourself up for verification - what were the starting stats? what raising method did you use? how many errantries? expeditions? peaches? magic bananas? etc - i am with the skeptics.

alrighty then. im just now raising a pure mock i got off a cd. right now, its 6 months old, so that should be good enough. Name- Trunker Current stats- 237 lif, 112 pow, 221 int, 128 ski, 98 spd, 110 defense. he has been raised well so far, but i am tipically tough on monsters during their infant stages, as strange as it sounds, but it gets they're loyalty up decently fast. The last few months i've been drilling him typically in ski. and defense, since they both started out poor. Until he is about a year old, i will train him every week, giving him nuts oil every other week to relieve stress, as well as mint leaves every non-nuts oil week. When he is exactly 1 year old, i will send him on the 1st errantry to learn twig gattling. He is now only 2 months away from the first official tourney, which i will enter him in. I fed him tablets every week, and so far he has never failed a drill or played truant, cheated, etc. He has never gotten stressed, or really even tired. The only time i have rested him so far is the first two weeks i got him, but with a NO every oter week, rest is almost completely unneccessary, though i do occasionally rest him after a tourney. he has had no special requests so far, and he likes tablets, and dislikes smoked snakes. i will update every other day on Trunkey's proggresion from here on out.

-- Golem Man (rapman243@aol.com), March 23, 2000.

If you have a TV tuner card on your pc (possibly in one of the new 3D cards), you can capture the image directly from the PSX, or your VCR if you taped it. You could also scan a polariod or use a digital camera, but photos of tv sets are notoriously difficult to see clearly.

By Nate Railsback on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 11:20 am:

Keep in mind people that if ANYONE tries to pull the con of a 23-year-old monster, screen shots aren't a definitive answer. There are gameshark codes available with all the rest that let you hack the monster's listed age.

By Dark Phoenix on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 03:13 pm:

Agreed, Nate. With my Gameshark Memory Editor and my knowledge of some of the key memory locations in MR2, I could fake a screen shot of a 23 year old Golem with unbearable ease and no one would be the wiser.

By locke on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 05:38 pm:

For those of us without the technical gameshark know-how, there's another easy way... A quick framegrab, a bit of cut and paste with good graphics software, and the same effect is achieved graphically. This can be done without any programming or gamecode skills.
